text: Henry Hardy Heins ( - ) was an American Lutheran minister, historian and bibliographer. He was born in Hollis, Queens on Long Island and received degrees from Hartwick College and Gettysburg Theological Seminary. He was ordained a Lutheran minister in 1948 and served at parishes in the upstate New York towns of Central Bridge, Liberty and Albany. Heins wrote books on history and a bibliography of Edgar Rice Burroughs, after collecting and studying his works for over 30 years. He died on in Albany at the age of 79. ==Works== * Throughout All the Years (1946) * Numeral Cancellations of the British Empire (1959) * A Golden Anniversary Bibliography of Edgar Rice Burroughs (1964) * Swan of Albany (1976) ==References== ===Bibliography=== * ==External links== * Category:1923 births Category:2003 deaths Category:American Lutheran clergy Category:20th-century American historians Category:American bibliographers Category:People from Hollis, Queens Category:Historians from New York (state)
title: Henry Hardy Heins
